greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation mapping from Ludic sieve to Lucky sieve: a(1) = 1, for n > 1: a(n) = A255551(A260738(n), A260739(n)).
comment: a(n) tells which number in array A255551 (constructed from Lucky sieve) is at the same position where n is in array A255127 (constructed from Ludic sieve). This permutation fixes all even numbers because both arrays have A005843 as their topmost row.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10105
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
formula: a(A003309(n+2)) = A000959(n+1). [Maps odd Ludic numbers to Lucky numbers.]
As a composition of related permutations:
program: (Scheme) (define (A260436 n) (if (<= n 1) n (A255551bi (A260738 n) (A260739 n)))) ;; Code for A255551bi given in A255551.
xref: Similar permutations: A255408, A255128, A255551, A255553, A249817, A249818, A260742 (a more recursed variant).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 30 2015
